title: Kumon or Soroban? I Spent a Week Agonizing – Here's What I Chose
description: Everyone recommends either Kumon or Soroban. They're completely different approaches. After days of research, I finally made a choice.
imageAlt: Comparing Kumon worksheets with Soroban abacus learning

content.intro: "You should try Kumon!" "No, Soroban is better!" I heard both constantly. They're completely different approaches to math. After a week of research, sleepless nights, and way too many browser tabs, I finally made a decision.

items: **Comprehensive curriculum:** Covers all math topics, not just calculation
**Proven track record:** Been around for decades, lots of success stories
**Structure:** Clear levels and progression
**Reading program too:** Can do math and reading together
**Mental math focus:** Builds calculation speed like nothing else
**Visual learning:** Great for kids who struggle with abstract concepts
**Engaging:** More interactive than worksheets
**Brain training:** Research shows benefits beyond just math
**Cost effective:** Apps much cheaper than centers
She's visual – learns better seeing things than reading instructions
She hates worksheets – Kumon would be a battle every day
She needs confidence in basic calculation first
Our budget is tight – Soroban app is 1/10th the cost

sections.text: There's no universally "better" choice. It depends on your child's learning style, your goals, your budget, and your family's schedule.

sections.text: Both approaches work. Many kids have succeeded with Kumon. Many with Soroban. What matters is picking one and sticking with it consistently.

faq.question: Can I do both Kumon and Soroban?
faq.answer: You can, but it's a lot. 45-60 minutes of Kumon plus 15-20 minutes of Soroban daily adds up. Most families pick one and stick with it.

faq.question: Which is better for school math grades?
faq.answer: Kumon covers more curriculum topics. Soroban specifically boosts calculation speed and confidence. Both can improve grades, through different paths.

faq.question: Is Soroban just for math prodigies?
faq.answer: No! Soroban works for all kids, including those struggling with math. The visual approach often helps kids who didn't "get" traditional methods.
